Name: Fire hydrant signage
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fire hydrant signage

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: October 29, 2015 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files

Summary: This bill would require the department of environmental protection to place signage on fire hydrants indicating that opening or tampering with the hydrants is prohibited, and provide information on penalties and as well as how to request a hydrant be opened, such as for a spray cap.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section 1. Section 24-308 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision f to read as follows:
      f. Any fire hydrant adjacent to a city street shall have upon it signage indicating that opening or tampering is prohibited, the possible penalties for a violation thereof, and information on how to request it be opened for public use. Such signage shall be placed in a manner that does not impede access to the fire hydrant.   
	ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect one year after it becomes law.
